data.headline: S&P 500 fell 0.3%, Dow lost 0.3%, Nasdaq dropped 0.5%, and Russell 2000 slid 0.7% amid broad market pressure.
bullets: AI-driven tech jitters and megacap weakness, led by Nvidia, Microsoft, and other Magnificent Seven and chip stocks, dragged the market lower.
Danaher and General Mills sank after disappointing earnings results.
Medtronic rebounded on strong Q3 performance, while Masimo weakened.
ZIM surged after receiving a $4.2B buyout offer.
Norwegian Cruise Line rallied on news of Elliott Management's interest.
Fiserv gained and Genuine Parts advanced on a dividend hike and spin-off plans.
M&A speculation around Warner Bros. Discovery–Paramount and Blackstone’s pursuit of Champions Group fueled deal hopes.
Chicago Fed President Goolsbee’s dovish comments on potential rate cuts offered only limited support.

Traders are looking ahead to key data releases including PCE inflation, Q4 GDP, Fed minutes, jobs reports, and major earnings from Walmart, Palo Alto Networks, DoorDash, Medtronic, Energy Transfer, and Vulcan Materials.
